title: Whereabouts Unknown
opening: Eliwood and colleagues defeat Bauker, one of Marquess Laus's lackeys. They then press on toward Castle Caelin. Yet inside the castle many Laus soldiers remain. Eliwood and friends begin their assault on the castle to save Marquess Caelin.
Near Laus, Hector defeats General Bauker. Hector and his allies now march toward Castle Caelin. However, many Laus soldiers await them inside. They begin their assault to liberate the castle.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Looks like there are still a lot of Laus soldiers in the castle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Lyndis, where are the Caelin guards?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I think about half of them were killed in the surprise attack. The survivors must be here somewhere…

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: They’re probably locked away as prisoners. Right. Well, let’s find and rescue them too!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I wish we had more power to make up for our poor numbers.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hold on, Grandfather… We’ll be there shortly.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Time to get inside! Let’s reclaim the castle! The key to victory is seizing the throne! That’s where we’ll find their commander I’m sure.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Um, hellooooo!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hm?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Are you from Castle Caelin?

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: I am. May I ask your business in the castle?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: I am Merlinus. I am a traveling merchant with goods beyond compare. If you would be so kind to hire me, I…

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: My apologies. Now is not the time.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Please, my lady… I’ve dreamt of working for a noble house for so long. By all means, please call on my services!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Old man! Are you truly a merchant?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Old… Old man?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: You’re being rude, Hector!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Right, right. Old…gentleman. Is it true you aspire to work for a noble house?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Yes, my boy. Yes, I do.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: In that case, we’d like to hire you.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Really?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: This journey could last a while, and we’ve acquired many items. It would be quite convenient if we had someone to manage our things.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Leave it to me! Managing…things is my specialty!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Our journey is dangerous, and has no end in sight. Is that acceptable?

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Did you say da-dangerous?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I’m brother to Marquess Ostia. He’s Marquess Pherae’s son. You can come with us if you so desire.

intro.speaker: Merlinus
intro.line: Oh? Ostia and Pherae? Nobility beyond compare! I’m coming! Most definitely!

battle.speaker: Lyn
battle.line: Please, I need all of you to help!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, my liege! We are yours to command!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Wil! Glad to see you’re well!

battle.speaker: Wil
battle.line: Yes, against all odds. Laus has some tough soldiers, but they can’t defeat us, can they?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: NEVER!!! Let’s show them the might of the Caelin knights!

battle.speaker: Kent
battle.line: Then let’s drive these knaves out of Castle Caelin!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: Rejoice, one and all! Your beloved subcommander is here to rescue you!

battle.speaker: Sain
battle.line: All right! Direct your energy on your foes and drive them out!

battle.speaker: Florina
battle.line: Yes, uhm… I’m with Lady Lyndis.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Nice work! Leave the rest to us!

battle.speaker: Florina
battle.line: Now, I’ll…uh…take you to Lord Eliwood. ……Huh? Wa-Wait for me!

recruit-talk.speaker: Lucius
recruit-talk.line: Lord Raven! I’m so pleased to see you well!

recruit-talk.speaker: Raven
recruit-talk.line: Things have changed. For the time being, we side with Caelin.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lucius
recruit-talk.line: That is good… So you’ve had a change of heart?

recruit-talk.speaker: Raven
recruit-talk.line: No, I will still have my revenge against House Ostia. The closer you are to your enemy, the easier it is to strike, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Lyn! Are you well?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Lucius?! Why are you here?

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Actually, I’ve been here for a few days as a mercenary.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: I didn’t know. Why didn’t you send word?

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Well…I’m… I’m traveling with someone, and… More importantly, I apologize for not being able to protect Castle Caelin. My lack of… strength… is truly shameful.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: It’s no one’s fault. The attack came so quickly. I was forced to flee myself. Now I simply want to rescue my grandfather as soon as possible. That is all I wish…

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: May…I offer… my assistance?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: It’s not necessary.

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Pardon?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Your hands are shaking terribly. I thank you for your offer, but you cannot fight in this condition.

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: I… I’m sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: It’s all right. I do ask that you help me when you’re able.

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Yes… Of course.

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Lyn! Are you well?

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: Lucius?! Why are you here?

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Actually, I’ve been here for a few days as a mercenary.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: I didn’t know. Why didn’t you send word?

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: Well…I’m… I’m traveling with someone, and… More importantly, I apologize for not being able to protect Castle Caelin. My lack of …strength… is truly shameful.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: It’s no one’s fault. The attack came so quickly. I was forced to flee myself. Now I simply want to rescue my grandfather as soon as possible. That is all I wish…

battle-talk.speaker: Lucius
battle-talk.line: I truly hope I can be of service.

battle-talk.speaker: Lyn
battle-talk.line: You can, Lucius. I’m counting on you.

boss.speaker: Bernard
boss.line: I am Bernard, Knight Commander of Laus! I would test the might of those who bested Bauker!

boss.speaker: Bernard
boss.line: This is a just reward… for Laus’s brutality…

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Grandfather! Grandfather! Where…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lord Hausen? Where are you?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Eliwood. Here, on the throne… It’s blood.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Blood? No! It can’t be!!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis! Calm down. He might only be injured. Come, let us find him.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Yes, you’re right. I must be calm. There! Over there! There’s someone…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Who’s there? Show yourself!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: You… Leila!

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Yes, it’s me, Lord Hector. It’s been a long time.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: You know her?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yes, her name’s Leila. She…works for Ostia… All right, she’s a spy.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Lord Eliwood of Pherae and Lady Lyndis of Caelin, correct? I am Leila. Pleased to make your acquaintance. Lady Lyndis, Marquess Caelin is back there receiving treatment.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: My grandfather is safe?!

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: …His life is yet his own.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Ah! Father Sky and Mother Earth! I thank you for your mercy!!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Leila, what are you doing here?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I… I’m following Lord Uther’s orders. I’m investigating Marquess Pherae’s disappearance.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: My father? What have you learned?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Come with me. We should talk in private.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Huh? Come on, Eliwood.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ah…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Worrying about things won’t change them.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I know. I’m fine. Let’s go!

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Let me start with my conclusion.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Marquess Pherae… is alive.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Whooooo! Eliwood!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: That’s wonderful!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Are you sure?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I’ve been posing as a member of the Black Fang for several months. That’s where I got this information. I believe it is true.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Black Fang… They’re the assassins guild that Erik spoke of.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Yes, we’ve known of their existence for quite some time.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Explain.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: The Black Fang is a guild of assassins founded about ten years ago by Brendan Reed. They’re based in Bern. Their arms reached quickly in several other countries. Originally, they targeted only nobles who abused their positions. The masses saw them as chivalrous, defenders of the common man. Their activities found wide support.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Chivalrous…

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Then about a year ago, Brendan got married again. Black Fang’s operations have slowly changed since then. Now, they’ll take on any target, no matter how difficult, as long as they’re paid. And they’re no longer killing only criminals; anyone is a fair target.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Is this Black Fang responsible for what’s happened to my grandfather?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Yes. We’ve learned of a mystery man named Nergal, behind Reed’s wife. It seems the Black Fang is performing secret tasks across Lycia for Nergal. Nergal’s trusted retainer Ephidel is with Marquess Laus. He manipulated Laus into hatching the rebellion plot against Ostia. The first to answer Laus’s call for rebellion was… Marquess Santaruz.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lord Helman… Why would you…

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Next was Lord Elbert, Marquess Pherae.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: You’re telling me that my father endorsed this plan?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I cannot say. I do know that he is with Marquess Laus currently. In a place called… the Dragon’s Gate.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Dragon’s Gate? Where is that?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: On an isle called Valor, off the southern coast of Lycia. I apologize, but that is all the information I have.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Of all places to be, Valor… Blast!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What kind of place is it?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: It’s said that those who step onto the island never return. The common folk call it the Dread Isle. If that’s where my father is, however,  I will go and find him.  And this “Dragon’s Gate,” too!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I’m going with you. I’ll tell you right now, you can’t stop me.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I’m also going.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis, I appreciate your kindness, but… Shouldn’t you stay with Marquess Caelin?

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Laus must be stopped. Otherwise, they might target my grandfather again. I also wish to help Eliwood’s father. Losing a parent… It’s an unbearable pain. It’s something I’d rather you didn’t have to feel yet.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Lyndis… Hector… Thank you. You give me strength.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Don’t mention it.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: We’re friends. It’s what friends do, Eliwood.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I’m also going to continue searching. Lady Lyndis, I think it would be prudent to let the world think Marquess Caelin is dead.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I understand. I’ll do that. Thank you.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: No thanks necessary. If you’ll excuse me.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Leila!

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Yes?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Nergal and this…Ephidel? What are they like?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: I’ve yet to lay eyes on Nergal. I’ve spoken to Ephidel on several occasions, however. He’s…eerie. He always wears a cloak that covers his face. And yet…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: His eyes glow golden… You can’t miss them. They seem…inhuman.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Is that you, Leila?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Matthew. It’s been a long time.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: What have you been doing? More dangerous work?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: We’re spies, Matthew. Everything we do is dangerous.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: That’s true. So how long do you think this mission’s going to last?

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: My objective is the same as yours: to rescue Marquess Pherae. If things go well, I’ll be in Ostia at the same time as you are.

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Is that so? You need to visit my hometown.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Is this where you were born? Why?

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: …To meet my parents.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: Hm? Matthew…

end.speaker: Matthew
end.line: Ha ha. Well, that’s that! See you.

end.speaker: Leila
end.line: As slippery as ever… Didn’t even wait for my reply.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Lady Lyndis!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Everyone… I’m happy to see you all well. I’m going after Marquess Laus. Protect my grandfather.

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: One moment, Lady Lyndis. Please take this jewel before you leave.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Jewel?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: We were able to move it before Laus’s men ransacked our vaults.

end.speaker: Other Soldier
end.line: We will take care of Lord Hausen. Please, Lady Lyndis, return to us safely.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I will. Thank you.
